comment: ? - Levenfish, in the Tournament book, wrote: "Illogical move. It was necessary to continue with Nb8-c6 in agreement with the prepared plan. Probably White would have replied with Rad1 and only now g7-g6 would have been good, with the reply Bd3-b1. Probably, against some other Master, the same position could have been reached by move transposition, but against Panov, brilliant attacking player, the move in the text is a mistake. The early castle weakening gives White the idea for a combination."
reasoning: The comment accurately explains the mistake made by the player, as it highlights the logical error in the move and provides insight into the consequences and alternatives that were overlooked.

reformulated: White's move was not the best decision in this situation. Levenfish suggests that White should have played Ne8-c6 to stick with their strategy.
